poem:
Title: "Echoes of Grenfell"

Seven years post flame's cruel dance,
The concrete monolith silent in remembrance,
Of 72 lives lost in sudden chance,
Survivors cloaked in disillusionment and dalliance.

Memorial strides on cold Friday morn,
Mark time's passage, expectation reborn,
Next month's ballot hints a new dawn,
The old guard falls, hope's arrow is drawn.
